title.narrative: Early Childhood Care and Education in KPK

description.narrative: The Early Childhood Care and Education (ECCE) program in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KPK) is a pilot program which is implemented by Save the Children Australia (SC Australia), through the Save the Children Federation Inc. (SC Pakistan). Funding is given to SC Australia via a grant payment for the ECCE KPK program with expectations to improve educational outcomes and access for children in government schools by increasing opportunities for learning and development, and by improving transitions into primary school for children aged 3 to 8 years. Implementation directly addresses the KPK Education Sector Plan and thereby seeks to improve provincial government ability to sustainably extend the right of education to all children. Implementation will take place in 400 schools in four districts of KPK Province: Peshawar, Abbottabad, Battagram, and Buner with approximately 205,000 direct beneficiaries, including 120,00 children, 4,800 teachers and school support staff.
